text: the UK has voted to leave the European
Union so what happens now the first
thing to say is that nothing will change
immediately for now the UK is still part
of the EU until politicians work out
what to do next expects lots of reaction
and regrets from Europe's main leaders
there could be emergency meetings
organised in Brussels everyone will want
to know when that official exit button
might be pushed the process is set out
in article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty which
gives a two-year period for the terms of
exit to be negotiated once the intention
to leave is formally announced it's not
clear when that will happen the UK and
the EU now have to work out a new deal
first on trade if the UK doesn't want to
exit the single market it could still
have to pay towards the EU budget and
still follow the EU rules and
regulations allowing the free movement
of people from elsewhere in Europe might
be required as well the status of
British citizens already living in other
EU countries and EU citizens living in
Britain will need to be worked out once
a deal is agreed and the UK formally
leaves many laws and regulations made in
the EU over the decades will need to be
updated into UK law
